page.title: 18CHANGES:LEASINGHAM (PART1)
page.content: In{1951,}all traffic north to Lincoln had to pass through Leasingham along Lincoln Road:one villager remembers a tail-back of traffic for hundreds of yards through the village,when a sudden freeze turned the road into a skating rink.Since the construction of the{A15 bypass road in the 1950's, traffic through the village is light and the village is a very quiet but thriving place. The{1951 census}showed only{465 {people}living in Leasingham,in small groups of dwellings mainly around the four sides of the village.The rest was grassland or farmland. In the present school grounds stood a stone-built{schoolhouse.}There were about{30 pupils,}who took mats to keep their feet warm on the stone floor.Opposite were the buildings and outhouses of{The Hall Farm.
